definitions.text: ammunition consisting of a cylindrical metal casing containing an explosive charge and a projectile; fired from a large gun
the material that forms the hard outer covering of many animals
hard outer covering or case of certain organisms such as arthropods and turtles
the hard usually fibrous outer layer of some fruits especially nuts
the exterior covering of a bird's egg
a rigid covering that envelops an object
examples: the satellite is covered with a smooth shell of ice

definitions.text: a very light narrow racing boat
the housing or outer covering of something
examples: the clock has a walnut case

definitions.text: a metal sheathing of uniform thickness (such as the shield attached to an artillery piece to protect the gunners)
the hard largely calcareous covering of a mollusc or a brachiopod

examples: The enemy has been shelling us all day
blast a passage through the mountain

definitions.text: fall out of the pod or husk
hit the pitches of hard and regularly
examples: He shelled the pitcher for eight runs in the first inning

definitions.text: look for and collect shells by the seashore
come out better in a competition, race, or conflict
examples: Agassi beat Becker in the tennis championship
Harvard defeated Yale in the last football game

definitions.text: remove from its shell or outer covering
